questiontext.text:
Example


Find the moment of inertia (about the \(x\)-axis) of the cube of side \(1\), mass \(M\) and density \(\rho\) shown below. [[jsxgraph width="400px" height="300px" ]] const board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('jxgbox', { boundingbox: [-1.6, 1.8, 1.8, -1.6], axis: false, showNavigation: false }); // Axes points const X = board.create('point', [0, 1.7], {visible: false, fixed: true}); const Y = board.create('point', [1.7, 0], {visible: false, fixed: true}); const Z = board.create('point', [-1.06, -1.06], {visible: false, fixed: true}); // Points const O = board.create('point', [0, 0], {visible: false, fixed: true}); const A = board.create('point', [1, 0], {visible: false, fixed: true}); const B = board.create('point', [0, 1], {visible: false, fixed: true}); const C = board.create('point', [-0.5, -0.5], {visible: false, fixed: true}); const D = board.create('point', [1, 1], {visible: false, fixed: true}); const E = board.create('point', [0.5, 0.6], {visible: false, fixed: true}); const F = board.create('point', [-0.5, 0.6], {visible: false, fixed: true}); const G = board.create('point', [0.5,-0.5], {visible: false, fixed: true}); // Axes with labels board.create('arrow', [O, X], {strokeColor: 'black', name: 'X', withLabel: false,fontSize: 12}); board.create('arrow', [O, Y], {strokeColor: 'black', name: 'Y', withLabel: false,fontSize: 12}); board.create('arrow', [O, Z], {strokeColor: 'black', name: 'Z', withLabel: false,fontSize: 12}); // lines board.create('line', [O, A], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); board.create('line', [O, B], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); board.create('line', [O, C], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); board.create('line', [B, F], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); board.create('line', [B, D], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); board.create('line', [F, E], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); board.create('line', [D, E], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); board.create('line', [F, C], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); board.create('line', [E, G], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); board.create('line', [D, A], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); board.create('line', [G, A], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); board.create('line', [C, G], {straightFirst: false, straightLast: false}); // Add other labels board.create('text', [4.2, 0, '\\(x\\)'], {fontSize: 12,fixed: true}); board.create('text', [0, 4.2, '\\(y\\)'], {fontSize: 12,fixed: true}); board.create('text', [-3.2, -3.2, '\\(z\\)'], {fontSize: 12,fixed: true}); board.create('text', [0.1, 1.1, '\\(1\\)'], {fontSize: 12,fixed: true}); board.create('text', [1.1, 0.1, '\\(1\\)'], {fontSize: 12,fixed: true}); board.create('text', [-0.6, -0.7, '\\(1\\)'], {fontSize: 12,fixed: true}); [[/jsxgraph]]

Solution

For the cube, \[\displaystyle \text{Mass = Volume} \times \text{Density} \quad\text{i.e.}\quad M = 1^3 \times \rho = \rho \] The moment of inertia (about the \(x\)-axis) is given by \[\displaystyle I_x = \rho \displaystyle\int_V (y^2+z^2) \;\mathrm{d}x = \rho\displaystyle\int_0^1 \displaystyle\int_0^1 \displaystyle\int_0^1 (y^2 + z^2) \;\mathrm{d}z \,\mathrm{d}y\,\mathrm{d}x \] This has been shown to equal \(\displaystyle \frac{2}{3}\) previously. Thus \(\displaystyle I_x = \frac{2}{3}\rho=\frac{2}{3}M\).
By applying symmetry, it can also be shown that the moments of inertia about the \(y\)- and \(z\)-axes are also equal to \(\displaystyle \frac{2}{3}M\).

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
